word: Seated upon the grassy plain, in the twilight of the spring evening, the people ate of the food that Christ had provided. . . . No human power could create from five barley loaves and two small fishes food sufficient to feed thousands of hungry people. And they said one to another, "This is of a truth that Prophet that should come into the world" (John 6:14). . . . He can conquer the nations, and give to Israel the long-sought dominion.
